Los Mangos, Ciudad Madero, TAMPS, Mexico
Abstract: The crystallization of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug [2-(4-isobutyl-phenyl) propionic acid] ibuprofen (IBP) on a hydroxypropyl cellulose (HPC) and polyacrylamide (PAAm) gel was studied as well as the release kinetics of the drug. The IBP was crystallized on the gel surface of HPC/PAAm. It had a prismatic shape and the growth was made in an aqueous medium; the crystallinity grade of the gels HPC/PAAm and HPC/PAAm-IBU increased to 68% and to 58%, respectively. The release of IBP is performed by two means: by a non-Fickian diffusion process and by relaxation of the chains of the gel; without regard to temperature and the diffusion media, this correlates with the lower critical solution temperature (LCST) of the proposed gel. This polymer matrix provides an option for releasing nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs in a temperature range of 35-39°C. Korsmeyer and Peppas mathematical model was simulated for data releases, statistically significant at 95% confidence level. © 2016 Claudia Alicia Castillo-Miranda et al.

Authors: Chu J.
Title: Mathematic model based on rotating electromagnetic theory used in building a thermal circuit used in food heater
Affiliations: Joint Lab of Information Sensing and Intelligent Control, Tianjin University of Technology and Education, Tianjin, China
Authors with affiliations: Chu, J., Joint Lab of Information Sensing and Intelligent Control, Tianjin University of Technology and Education, Tianjin, China
Abstract: Rapid development of China's economy, changing population structure and reformed economic structure drives rapid growth of energy consumption. As a result, energy safety gradually becomes a hot spot in energy development. Electricity heating technology has been concerned for a long time as a safe and effective mean; as a result, it has developed into a subject integrating electric engineering, pyrology and materials science. A fundamental research is carried out on food heater in this study. First, static electromagnetic induction heating and dynamic electromagnetic induction heating were introduced. To solve reverse problems of temperature rise, thermal power mathematical theoretical model and thermal circuit model of food heater were established based on electromagnetic field and empirical formula. Finally, under certain rotating speed, thermal power in short-circuited winding as well as eddy current thermal power and magnetic hysteresis thermal power in solid iron core was analyzed.
Author Keywords: Food heater; Mathematical theoretical model; Rotating electromagnetic theory; Themal power; Thermal circuit model
Index Keywords: Circuit simulation; Circuit theory; Economics; Electric fields; Electric windings; Electromagnetic fields; Electromagnetic induction; Energy utilization; Induction heating; Population statistics; Reconfigurable hardware; Dynamic electromagnetic; Electromagnetic theories; Fundamental research; Population structures; Short-circuited winding; Themal power; Theoretical modeling; Thermal circuit model; Eddy current testing

Authors: Kurakova O., Khomyak N.
Title: Scenarios of Applying of Game Theory in Development Projects of Underground Construction
Affiliations: Moscow State University of Civil Engineering, Yaroslavskoye sh. 26, Moscow, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Kurakova, O., Moscow State University of Civil Engineering, Yaroslavskoye sh. 26, Moscow, Russian Federation; Khomyak, N., Moscow State University of Civil Engineering, Yaroslavskoye sh. 26, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: The present situation of crisis in the economic of Russian Federation made impossible further realization of widespread investment building projects based on originally credits and made the most important to find new strategies of surviving and development of construction which are adequate to the modern realms of building market. Any project of underground construction may be looked like huge investment development project depended on the logic of its realization. Building of optimal strategy of project should be started with assumption that nobody can create their strategy acts of others mates of a project. With the game theory developer takes the opportunity to predict steps of his mates and opponents. The hard instrumentary should be used only in the case of very important strategy decisions. The mathematic modelizing is very useful instrument of solving problems of management of investment building project. The most simple optimizing and game theory models which sets the available directions searches in this space was described in this work. The ecomic-mathematical model lets to find optimal prices of real estate according to opportunities of paying their bills at the level of single development company, also the optimal financial strategy in the situation of economic crisis. Game theory models in common form describes opponents relationships between development companies and game theory models in a form of characteristic functions describes cooperation relationship between developments, as union of resources, merger, and absorption. Ierarchic game models represent the relationship between developments and banks (investors) or developers and providers and of course serve as a foundation for management of stable development of investment building complex of a region. © 2016 The Authors.
Author Keywords: development projects; financing; investor; mathematic modeling; strategy; underground building
Index Keywords: Buildings; Economics; Investments; Mergers and acquisitions; Planning; Sustainable development; Underground buildings; Development project; financing; investor; Mathematic model; strategy; Game theory

Authors: Galdin M.S., Andreev S.M.
Title: Model-based predictive control of twin-roll strip casting thermal mode
Affiliations: Nosov Magnitogorsk State Technical University, Automated Control Systems Department, Magnitogorsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Galdin, M.S., Nosov Magnitogorsk State Technical University, Automated Control Systems Department, Magnitogorsk, Russian Federation; Andreev, S.M., Nosov Magnitogorsk State Technical University, Automated Control Systems Department, Magnitogorsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Twin-roll strip casting is one of the most promising technologies for the production of hot rolled steel strip. Liquid steel from mold is cast in 5 to 8 mm thick strip. After casting, the strip enters the roll stand, where it undergoes final plastic forming. The main goal of thermal mode control system is mass-average temperature stabilization at the hot rolling stand. The control of thermal mode is chiefly realized by changing the speed of casting. Significant time delay requires using the model-based predictive control systems. Block diagram of the twin-roll strip casting model-based predictive control system developed is provided in this paper. Distinctive features of the developed system are based on the previously developed mathematical model of the process and specialized command module. This module provides a real-time optimization of performance and conformity of the used models with current conditions. Modeling of the system performance in dynamic operating conditions of the unit is realized. Results of the modeling are presented in the form of transient process control system. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: mathematic modeling; predictive control; thermal mode of casting; twin-roll strip casting
Index Keywords: Casting; Control systems; Delay control systems; Hot rolling; Manufacture; Model predictive control; Predictive control systems; Strip metal; Time delay; Hot rolled steel strips; Mathematic model; Model based predictive control; Predictive control; Real-time optimization; Temperature stabilization; Thermal modes; Twin-roll strip casting; Process control

Authors: Nikitin P.V., Zagaynova E.N., Zagaynov I.A., Blinova M.L., Safina T.A.
Title: The mathematical business - Risks assessment model in organization administration
Affiliations: Interregional Open Social Institute, Mari State University, Yoshkar-Ola, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Nikitin, P.V., Interregional Open Social Institute, Mari State University, Yoshkar-Ola, Russian Federation; Zagaynova, E.N., Interregional Open Social Institute, Mari State University, Yoshkar-Ola, Russian Federation; Zagaynov, I.A., Interregional Open Social Institute, Mari State University, Yoshkar-Ola, Russian Federation; Blinova, M.L., Interregional Open Social Institute, Mari State University, Yoshkar-Ola, Russian Federation; Safina, T.A., Interregional Open Social Institute, Mari State University, Yoshkar-Ola, Russian Federation
Abstract: This paper focuses on the mathematic modeling of business - risks assessment in organization administration under conditions of volatile economic environment. This mathematic modeling is based on the foundation of establishment of dependences probability ratio between states of passages and degree of theirs impact. The analysis of mathematic modeling makes it possible to improve efficiency of business-processes, to reduce production costs and to define vulnerabilities. Markov analysis, one of the statistical methods of risk assessment, is used as the basis of modeling and definition of the probability of appearance of loss in mathematical model. An organization will be able essentially reduce the expenses on reconstruction of schemes of interaction of structures of enterprise with the help of this model. © International Economic Society.
Author Keywords: Business - risk assessment; Intensity assessment; Markov analysis; Mathematic modeling; Random model

Authors: Akib I.
Title: The description of relationship between mathematics charasteristic and Bugis culture values
Affiliations: Muhammadiyah University of Makassar, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Akib, I., Muhammadiyah University of Makassar, Indonesia
Abstract: The research was a descriptive qualitative research with an emphasis on the exploration of mathematical characteristics and Bugis culture value. The data collected in this study were analyzed using content analysis. Results of the analysis showed that the characteristics of mathematics are linked to Bugis culture value. The study findings included that the deductive-axiomatic mindset associated with the values of honesty, universality in mathematic related to the value of decency, non contradictions associated with dependability and value in mathematic agreements related to the value of loyalty. © Research India Publications.
Author Keywords: Bugis culture values; Mathematic characteristic

Authors: Wei J., Li Z., Hasegawa M.
Title: The effect of atmosphere on arcing durations of electrical contact
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, College of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Huazhong Univ. of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Dept. of Global System Design, Chitose Inst. Of Science and Technology, Chitose, Japan

Of Science and Technology, Chitose, Japan
Abstract: In order to investigate influences of surrounding atmospheres on breaking arc duration characteristics of electrical contacts, breaking arc durations were measured in several kinds of atmospheres (N2, Ar, He, air, O2 and COi) under different voltage and current conditions, respectively. A quantitative mathematic model, which aims to explain dependences of breaking arc durations on gas parameters such as specific heat capacity, molecular mass, electronegativity, and thermal conductivity, was searched through data fitting processes. Obtained results indicated that appropriate selections of a function for the data fitting processes as well as their optimization is critical to realize a satisfactory mathematic model.

Authors: Yao J., Zhang H., Zhu J., Xu Y., Zhao Y.
Title: Fault diagnosis and reconfiguration of pre-stressed fault-tolerant six-axis force sensor
Affiliations: Parallel Robot and Mechatronic System Laboratory of Hebei Province, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China; Key Laboratory of Advanced Forging and Stamping Technology and Science, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China
Authors with affiliations: Yao, J., Parallel Robot and Mechatronic System Laboratory of Hebei Province, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China, Key Laboratory of Advanced Forging and Stamping Technology and Science, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China; Zhang, H., Parallel Robot and Mechatronic System Laboratory of Hebei Province, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China; Zhu, J., Parallel Robot and Mechatronic System Laboratory of Hebei Province, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China; Xu, Y., Parallel Robot and Mechatronic System Laboratory of Hebei Province, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China; Zhao, Y., Parallel Robot and Mechatronic System Laboratory of Hebei Province, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China, Key Laboratory of Advanced Forging and Stamping Technology and Science, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, China
Abstract: Aimed at one pre-stressed fault-tolerant six-axis force sensor, measuring model, fault-diagnosis, faulty limb identification, and reconfiguration model are thoroughly analyzed and researched. Compared with the traditional six-axis force sensor based on Stewart structure, the pre-stressed fault-tolerant six-axis force sensor possesses the property of fault-tolerance. With screw theory and deformation coordination, the mathematic models including fault-free mathematic model and signal fault mathematic model are established. Based on the mathematic models, a method for fault-diagnosis is proposed based on the uniqueness of the force mapping matrix. The method for the identification of faulty limb of pre-stressed fault-tolerant six-axis force sensor is proposed and verified by experiment. Moreover, reconfiguration idea for six-axis force sensor is proposed. In the LabVIEW-based environment, the programs including fault-diagnosis and reconfiguration model are written. The research lays a theoretical and experimental foundation for the application of the fault-tolerant six-axis force sensor. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2016.
Author Keywords: Fault diagnosis; Fault-tolerant; Reconfiguration model; Six-axis force sensor
Index Keywords: Failure analysis; Fault tolerance; Program diagnostics; Reconfigurable hardware; Deformation coordination; Fault-tolerant; Force mapping; Mathematic model; Measuring model; Reconfiguration model; Screw theory; Six axis force sensor; Fault detection

Authors: Kou Y., Yang J., Kou Z.
Title: A water hammer protection method for mine drainage system based on velocity adjustment of hydraulic control valve
Affiliations: Research Institute of Machinery and Electronics, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Key Laboratory of Advanced Transducers and Intelligent Control System, Ministry of Education, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Taiyuan University of Technology College of Mechanical Engineering, Mine Fluid Control Engineering Research Center (Laboratory) in Shanxi Province, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Kou, Y., Research Institute of Machinery and Electronics, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China, Key Laboratory of Advanced Transducers and Intelligent Control System, Ministry of Education, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Yang, J., Research Institute of Machinery and Electronics, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China, Key Laboratory of Advanced Transducers and Intelligent Control System, Ministry of Education, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Kou, Z., Taiyuan University of Technology College of Mechanical Engineering, Mine Fluid Control Engineering Research Center (Laboratory) in Shanxi Province, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: Water hammer analysis is a fundamental work of pipeline systems design process for water distribution networks. The main characteristics for mine drainage system are the limited space and high cost of equipment and pipeline changing. In order to solve the protection problem of valve-closing water hammer for mine drainage system, a water hammer protection method for mine drainage system based on velocity adjustment of HCV (Hydraulic Control Valve) is proposed in this paper. The mathematic model of water hammer fluctuations is established based on the characteristic line method. Then, boundary conditions of water hammer controlling for mine drainage system are determined and its simplex model is established. The optimization adjustment strategy is solved from the mathematic model of multistage valve-closing. Taking a mine drainage system as an example, compared results between simulations and experiments show that the proposed method and the optimized valve-closing strategy are effective. © 2016 Yanfei Kou et al.
Index Keywords: Hydraulic machinery; Pipelines; Safety valves; Water distribution systems; Water hammer; Water supply systems; Characteristic line method; Design process; Hydraulic control valves; Mathematic model; Pipe-line systems; Water distribution networks; Water hammer protections; Waterhammer analysis; Drainage

Title: Fuzzy logic controller for Static Synchronous Compensator to enhance voltage stability of power systems
Affiliations: Jiangsu EPRI, SGCC, Electric Power Metering Key Lab of State Grid, No.9 Aoti Street, Jianye District, Nanjing City, Jiangsu Province, China; State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Research Institute, No.9 Aoti Street, Jianye District, Nanjing City, Jiangsu Province, China

Abstract: This paper investigated mathematical modelling and control scheme of Static Synchronous Compensator (STATCOM) based on fuzzy logic controller. At first, based on switching functions, a mathematic model of STATCOM in the form of a matrix was presented. Then, to overcome the problem of lacking an accurate model of a power system with STATCOM, a fuzzy logic PI controller was established in the feedback loop circuit. The membership function of the fuzzy logic controller was gained through the collection of experimental data. The proposed control scheme and the mathematic model were validated by MATLAB simulation, which showed that STATCOM with the designed fuzzy logic controller was able to improve the transient stability and voltage stability of power systems effectively. © 2016 The authors and IOS Press. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yu Y.
Title: Research on digital art creation based on artificial intelligence
Affiliations: Guangdong South China Institute of Industrial Design, Guangdong University of Technology, Dongguan, Guangdong, China
Authors with affiliations: Yu, Y., Guangdong South China Institute of Industrial Design, Guangdong University of Technology, Dongguan, Guangdong, China
Abstract: With the development of digital information technology and the wide application of artificial intelligence technology, digital art creation is developing towards the direction of artificial intelligence. In order to establish an intelligent design system for digital art, this paper introduces the application of artificialintelligence technology in the management system. It describes the definition and characteristics of digital art, and establishes a mathematic model for intelligent calligraphy creation. On the basis of the establishment of the mathematic model, this paper analyzes the process and the result of the digital art design, carries out the value of it, and carries out experimental analysis of the effective demand of Chinese Digital Art. In a word, AI technology can improve the development of digital art design, and the digital art has an important role in the social development.

Abstract: Outer P-set, a new mathematic method of studying dynamic information, is a part of P-set theory. Based on the outer P-set theory, such conceptions have been put forward as principles of F -information concealing granulation degree, F -information concealing relationship, F -information concealing generation, concealing and concealing information recovery and definitions of outer-distance and concealing granulation degree. Title: The application of simulation method in one dimension pipeline flow based on elastic pipeline
Affiliations: Petrochina Pipeline R and D Center, Langfang, China; China University of Petroleum (East China), Qingdao, China; Petrochina Pipeline Jinan Oil Transportation Sub-Company, Jinan, China

Abstract: This paper describes a complete method to simulate the one dimension elastic pipeline flow. The pipe is controlled horizontally and initial conditions and boundary conditions are set in order to close the calculation equation. Governing equations are chosen in the set condition. A new interactive method is used to calculate the mathematic model of elastic pipeline. Finally, the flow data in one dimension pipeline is obtained. © 2016 Taylor & Francis Group, London.
Index Keywords: Condensed matter physics; Energy management; Energy resources; Materials science; Elastic pipelines; Flow based; Flow data; Governing equations; Initial conditions; Interactive methods; Mathematic model; One dimension; Pipelines

Authors: Zharova E.
Title: Education in natural sciences vs education in biology in the universities of the Russian empire: The road to specialization
Affiliations: Department of Science in Biology, Bryansk State University, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Zharova, E., Department of Science in Biology, Bryansk State University, Russian Federation
Abstract: The problem of specialization is an important aspect of the evolution of university education. The expansion of scientific knowledge led inevitably to specialization Physics and Mathematics faculty begun specialization by dividing into two departments of natural and mathematic sciences. In the late 19th - early 20th cc. the department of natural sciences had several divisions that helped further specialization, but this conflicted with the need to produce in school teachers with broader education in science.
Author Keywords: History of biology; Natural departments; Physic and mathematic faculties; Russian empire; Specialization; University history

Authors: Ivashkina E.N., Ivanchina E.D., Nurmakanova A.E., Boychenko S.S., Ushakov A.S., Dolganova I.O.
Title: Mathematical Modeling Sulfuric Acid Catalyzed Alkylation of Isobutane with Olefins
Affiliations: National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, 30 Lenin Avenue, Tomsk, Russian Federation
Authors with affiliations: Ivashkina, E.N., National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, 30 Lenin Avenue, Tomsk, Russian Federation; Ivanchina, E.D., National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, 30 Lenin Avenue, Tomsk, Russian Federation; Nurmakanova, A.E., National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, 30 Lenin Avenue, Tomsk, Russian Federation; Boychenko, S.S., National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, 30 Lenin Avenue, Tomsk, Russian Federation; Ushakov, A.S., National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, 30 Lenin Avenue, Tomsk, Russian Federation; Dolganova, I.O., National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, 30 Lenin Avenue, Tomsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The article provides the results of applied mathematical model of sulfuric acid catalyzed alkylation of isobutane with olefins. It was shown that increasing the content of propylene in the feedstock to 2% leads to decrease in octane number of alkylate to 0.5-1.0 points. Alkylates produced from feedstock with less isobutane mass fraction have a smaller value of octane number. Using mathematic model it was determined that the main parameter influencing the acid activity in the alkylation process is the fresh acid concentration. © 2016 The Authors.

Authors: Li X., Wu F.
Title: Desertification features in Dengkou county from 1986 to 2011
Affiliations: College of Business and Commercial, Hebei GEO University, Shijiazhuang, China; College of Earth Science and Resources, China University of Geosciences, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, X., College of Business and Commercial, Hebei GEO University, Shijiazhuang, China; Wu, F., College of Earth Science and Resources, China University of Geosciences, Beijing, China
Abstract: This research is based on two phase of TM remote sensing in 1986 and 2011. The desertification in Dengkou county is classified into five types, as none desertification, light desertification, moderate desertification, heavy desertification and sever desertification. The TM data is analyzed through dimidate pixel model, overlay analysis, related mathematic model, and the data shows that, desertification is in a very danger degree. Among the types of desertification, sever desertification accounts largest proportion, and light desertification follows. Through correlation analysis, data shows light dertification, moderate and sever types are driven by social factors, while light type is driven mainly by natural factors.
Author Keywords: Dengkou county; Desertification; Dimidate pixel model; Remote sensing
Index Keywords: Climatology; Geology; Natural resources management; Pixels; Planning; Remote sensing; Resource allocation; Sustainable development; Correlation analysis; Dengkou counties; Desertification; Mathematic model; Natural factors; Overlay analysis; Pixel models; Social factor; Weathering

Authors: Liu J., Zeng G.
Title: A tactic research of eliminating the conflict of using electromagnetic spectrum in the battlefield environment
Affiliations: PLA Academy of National Defence Information, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, J., PLA Academy of National Defence Information, Wuhan, China; Zeng, G., PLA Academy of National Defence Information, Wuhan, China
Abstract: In the battlefield using electromagnetic spectrum management, it is demanded that the traditional static mode of allocating electromagnetic spectrum should be switched into the dynamic one, which can optimize the allocation and use of electromagnetic spectrum so as to enhance the quality of the battlefield communications. Based on apperceiving the resource of battlefield electromagnetic spectrum, this paper puts forward the tactics of disposing the conflicts of using battlefield electromagnetic spectrum, set up the mathematic model of dynamically allocating battlefield electromagnetic spectrum, and made a simulation experiment. The result of the simulation experiment shows that the tactic of holistically eliminating conflict and the corresponding model possesses a definite practicability and maneuverability. © Springer India 2016.

Authors: Fu W., Zhang Q., Huang G., Li P., Cui B., Tu R.
Title: Performance analysis of real-time BDS clock estimation with different orbit accuracy
Affiliations: School of Geology Engineering and Geomatics, Chang’an University, No.126, Yanta Road, Xi’an, China; Chinese Academy of National Timing Service Center, Shu Yuan Road, Xi’an, China
Authors with affiliations: Fu, W., School of Geology Engineering and Geomatics, Chang’an University, No.126, Yanta Road, Xi’an, China; Zhang, Q., School of Geology Engineering and Geomatics, Chang’an University, No.126, Yanta Road, Xi’an, China; Huang, G., School of Geology Engineering and Geomatics, Chang’an University, No.126, Yanta Road, Xi’an, China; Li, P., School of Geology Engineering and Geomatics, Chang’an University, No.126, Yanta Road, Xi’an, China; Cui, B., School of Geology Engineering and Geomatics, Chang’an University, No.126, Yanta Road, Xi’an, China; Tu, R., Chinese Academy of National Timing Service Center, Shu Yuan Road, Xi’an, China
Abstract: Based on un-differenced model of clock estimation, the mathematic model of real-time clock estimation influenced by orbit error is derived, and then the estimation accuracy of BDS real-time clock and real-time positioning accuracy are analyzed. The results show that real-time BDS clock accuracy achieves 0.30 ns using the rapid orbit product and the corresponding 2-D and 3-D real-time positioning accuracy are 0.36 and 0.48 m, respectively. With 0.1 and 0.2 m orbit error influenced, the decreased accuracy of real-time clock estimation is 0.05 and 0.14 ns, and the decreased positioning accuracy is 0.057 and 0.154 m, respectively. © Springer Science+Business Media Singapore 2016.

Authors: Nogal M., Lozano J.A., Turmo J.
Title: Comparison among different structural system identification methods
Affiliations: Trinity College, Ireland; University of Castilla-La, Mancha, Spain; Universitat Politcnica de Catalunya, Spain
Authors with affiliations: Nogal, M., Trinity College, Ireland; Lozano, J.A., University of Castilla-La, Mancha, Spain; Turmo, J., Universitat Politcnica de Catalunya, Spain
Abstract: The observability techniques have been proposed to deal with structural system identification under static loading tests. Up to now, this method has only been analyzed from a symbolical point of view. Despite the elegance of this approach, this mathematic analysis is far from being applicable in actual structures. To fill this gap, this paper presents a new observability procedure that combines both a symbolical and a numerical approach. To illustrate the potential of the proposed method, the observability technique is compared with two alternative methods presented in the literature. This comparison shows that, unlike to other analyzed methods, no information from the undamaged structure is required. Furthermore, the number of measurements required to be measured for damage detection is significantly reduced.,.
Author Keywords: Observability analysis; Static test; Structural system identification
Index Keywords: Observability; Religious buildings; Sustainable development; Mathematic analysis; Numerical approaches; Observability analysis; Static loading test; Static tests; Structural system identification; Damage detection

Authors: Li S.
Title: Modeling and simulation research of ball end mill rake face
Affiliations: College of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, Zaozhuang University Shandong Province, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, S., College of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, Zaozhuang University Shandong Province, China
Abstract: According to the structure of the ball end mill and the cutter grinding principle, a mathematic model related to the ball blade rake face and circumference blade rake face was established. On the Solidworks platform, the rational motor program was compiled and the machining process of the ball end mill rake face was simulated. Through the analysis of the simulation results, the accuracy of the rake face mathematical model was proved. The ball end part has the proper S-shaped arc blade. The ball blade was smoothly connected with the circumference blade. The ball blades had a relatively large positive rake angle and were rationally distributed. All these provided the basis for the development of low-cost and high-profit CNC cutter grinding devices. Copyright © 2016, AIDIC Servizi S.r.l.
Index Keywords: Grinding (machining); Machining; Milling machines; Ball end mill; Cutter grinding; Machining Process; Mathematic model; Model and simulation; Motor programs; Rake angle; SolidWorks; Ball mills

Authors: Chu X., Liu C., Zhang C., Song J., Zhou H., Wang J.
Title: Correlation between cross section and shearing force during cutting potato stalk
Affiliations: College of Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; College of Mechanical Engineering, Jiamusi University, Jiamusi, China
Authors with affiliations: Chu, X., College of Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China, College of Mechanical Engineering, Jiamusi University, Jiamusi, China; Liu, C., College of Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Zhang, C., College of Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Song, J., College of Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Zhou, H., College of Mechanical Engineering, Jiamusi University, Jiamusi, China; Wang, J., College of Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China
Abstract: In order to research the correlation between cross section and shearing force during cutting potato stalk, the cross-sectional microstructures of potato stalk were observed by scanning electronic microscopy, and the simplified model of microstructure was built. The experiment was conducted to test the shearing force of potato stalk by using the universal testing machine. The results showed that the correlation was significant between cross-sectional microstructure and shearing force. The shearing force was greatly affected by the epidermis and vascular bundle, and the microstructure had a profound effect on the fluctuating peak of shearing force. In the ordinary course of events, the thicker vascular bundle, the bigger cross-sectional outside diameter and shearing force, and the shearing force was not over 200 N when the cross-sectional outside diameter less than 10 mm. The mathematic model relationship of shearing force and cross-sectional outside diameter was built according to the statistical data, and it is the foundation of cutting device designing.
Author Keywords: Agricultural engineering; Cross-sectional microstructure; Potato stalk; Shearing force
Index Keywords: Agricultural engineering; Agricultural machinery; Microstructure; Testing; Cross-sectional microstructure; Mathematic model; Outside diameter; Potato stalk; Scanning electronic microscopy; Shearing force; Statistical datas; Universal testing machines; Shearing

Authors: Huang Y., Mo W., Lu G., Wang Y., Luan L., Xu Z., Wang H.
Title: Economic analysis of home-based micro-grid under non-real-time pricing mechanism
Affiliations: Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co., Ltd., China; Electric Power Research Institute, China Southern Power Gird, China
Authors with affiliations: Huang, Y., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co., Ltd., China; Mo, W., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co., Ltd., China; Lu, G., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co., Ltd., China; Wang, Y., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co., Ltd., China; Luan, L., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co., Ltd., China; Xu, Z., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co., Ltd., China; Wang, H., Electric Power Research Institute, China Southern Power Gird, China
Abstract: The subject addressed is to discuss economic efficiency of home-based micro-grids under non-real-time pricing mechanism. Firstly, configurations of investment and return are decomposed in terms of home-based microgrid under the background of China's current renewable generation policies and residential non-real-time electricity pricing mechanism. Secondly, a mathematic model of cost/benefit is developed to analyse the economic efficiency during its whole life cycle. One practical case from a demonstration project in Guangzhou is provided to illustrate the analysis in this paper. Furthermore, sensitivity analysis is applied to main factors which potentially impact on economic efficiency of home-based micro-grid system. Results show that price and quality of main equipment are the most potential keys to enhance economic incentives of home-based micro-grid power system in China.
Index Keywords: Costs; Economics; Efficiency; Electric power system economics; Life cycle; Sensitivity analysis; Demonstration project; Economic efficiency; Economic incentive; Electricity pricing; Mathematic model; Micro-grid systems; Renewable generation; Whole life cycles; Economic analysis

Authors: Timchenko L., Yarovyi A., Kokriatskaya N., Nakonechna S., Abramenko L., Ławicki T., Popiel P., Yesmakhanova L.
Title: The method of parallel-hierarchical transformation for rapid recognition of dynamic images using GPGPU technology
Affiliations: State Economic Technological University of Transport, 19 Lukashevich Street, Kyiv, Ukraine; Vinnytsia National Technical University, 95 Khmelnytske shose, Vinnytsia, Ukraine; Lublin University of Technology, Institute of Electronics and Information Technology, Nadbystrzycka 38D, Lublin, Poland

Abstract: The paper presents a method of parallel-hierarchical transformations for rapid recognition of dynamic images using GPU technology. Direct parallel-hierarchical transformations based on cluster CPU-and GPU-oriented hardware platform. Mathematic models of training of the parallel hierarchical (PH) network for the transformation are developed, as well as a training method of the PH network for recognition of dynamic images. This research is most topical for problems on organizing high-performance computations of super large arrays of information designed to implement multi-stage sensing and processing as well as compaction and recognition of data in the informational structures and computer devices. This method has such advantages as high performance through the use of recent advances in parallelization, possibility to work with images of ultra dimension, ease of scaling in case of changing the number of nodes in the cluster, auto scan of local network to detect compute nodes. © 2016 SPIE.

Authors: Li J., Tan G., Ji Y., Zhou Y., Liu Z., Xu Y.
Title: Design and Simulation Analysis for an Integrated Energy-Recuperation Retarder
Affiliations: Wuhan University of Technology, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, J., Wuhan University of Technology, China; Tan, G., Wuhan University of Technology, China; Ji, Y., Wuhan University of Technology, China; Zhou, Y., Wuhan University of Technology, China; Liu, Z., Wuhan University of Technology, China; Xu, Y., Wuhan University of Technology, China
Abstract: Vehicle auxiliary braking system is very significant to the brake safety. The eddy current retarder (ECR) has a good braking performance, but the braking torque would fade under high speed domain. In the contrary, the regenerative brake (RGB) could provide a satisfied braking performance in high speed domain. However, the braking torque in low speed domain is insufficient. This paper proposed a novel concept of the integrated energy-recuperation retarder (IEER), which would take advantage of the merits of both the ECR and the RGB to have a steady braking performance in all-speed domain. The IEER integrates the structures of rotary eddy current retarder (RECR) and the RGB, both of which share a stator. Braking torque of the IEER produced by stator core and armature-windings can stack together, and therefore the IEER can provide greater braking torque than the RECR. Besides, the IEER can recover electric energy from armature-windings. The IEER can weaken the recession of braking torque effectively, and possess a high electric energy-recovery power in theory. This paper aims at the matching of the braking torque and the electric energy-recovery power. Firstly, the braking torque's mathematic models of the IEER and the RECR are derivate respectively, and the electric energy-recovery power's mathematic models of the IEER and the RGB are also established respectively. Then, the simulation tests based on MATLAB/SIMULINK are set up considering the variables of the rotating speed, and the finite element method is applied in Ansoft Maxwell considering the Inhomogeneous magnetic field in the IEER. Finally, braking torque's property of the IEER and the RECR, and electric energy-recovery power's property of the IEER and the RGB come out. The simulation results reveal the obviously smaller recession of the braking torque compared with the RECR, while the electric energy-recovery power is nearly identical to the RGB. Copyright © 2016 SAE International.
Index Keywords: Brakes; Eddy currents; Electric windings; Finite element method; Magnetic levitation vehicles; MATLAB; Recovery; Regenerative braking; Speed; Stators; Torque; Winding; Armature windings; Auxiliary braking; Design and simulation; Eddy current retarder; Electric energies; Energy recuperation; Inhomogeneous magnetic field; Mathematic model; Braking performance

Authors: Strutynskyi V.B., Hurzhiy A.A., Kolot O.V., Polunichev V.E.
Title: Determination of development grounds and characteristics of mobile multi-coordinate robotic machines for materials machining in field conditions
Affiliations: National Technical University of Ukraine, Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, Kyiv, Ukraine; LLC Advanced Network Consulting, Kyiv, Ukraine
Authors with affiliations: Strutynskyi, V.B., National Technical University of Ukraine, Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, Kyiv, Ukraine; Hurzhiy, A.A., LLC Advanced Network Consulting, Kyiv, Ukraine; Kolot, O.V., National Technical University of Ukraine, Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, Kyiv, Ukraine; Polunichev, V.E., National Technical University of Ukraine, Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, Kyiv, Ukraine
Abstract: Purpose: Theoretical foundation and development of equipment for precision machining of objects in the field condition. Methodology: Mainly, the theoretical research methods which include the determination of the elastic system stiffness matrix of the machine and the manipulator were applied. Circuit and structural solutions of mobile multicoordinate robotic machine were theoretically grounded. Mathematic simulation of the object processing with the mobile robotic machine was conducted. On the basis of the mathematic simulation analysis, the peculiarities of deformation characteristics of machine were defined through the determined stiffness matrices. Findings: The concept of precision machining of objects in the field conditions with a mobile robotic machine was substantiated. It is based on the application of equipment with low stiffness in conjunction with a special manipulator, which is tightly linked to the object and provides the necessary movement of a tool. The circuit of the precision machining of objects with mobile robotic machine was grounded. This circuit fulfills the use of two dual mechanisms-hexapods, one of which is the pivotal system of the machine and the other is the system of manipulator. The means of machine working space increase by means of telescopic rods of the variable length with the pneumatic drives were suggested. Conditions for the improvement of the accuracy of the robotic machine during the process of machining with a rotary cutting tool were determined. They include accordance of the main axes of the manipulator stiffness matrix and the movement direction of the rotary cutting tool. The type and nature of the machining faults and their interrelation with the parameters of the machine stiffness and the manipulator stiffness were determined. originality: For the first time the concept of precision machining with robotic machines that have low stiffness of the carrying system is developed. The concept consists in the application of the manipulator that is rigidly fixed to the processed object and associated with the final controlling element of the machine. The component of stiffness matrix of the machine and the manipulator are brought into proper correlation, which provides the possibility of precision machining with mobile robotic machines. The fault calculation methods of the details processing with a rotary cutting tool on machines with parallel kinematic structures have attained the further development. Practical value: The results of the research are the basis for the development of high-performance robotic machines for machining the hazardous objects in the field conditions. On the basis of the obtained results the working space of the mobile robotic machine increases by 3-5 times and precision of machining in the field condition increases to 8-9 accuracy degree. © Strutynskyi V. B., Hurzhiy A. A., Kolot O.V., Polunichev V. E.,2016.
Author Keywords: Axial tools; Charts; Mobile robot machine; Models; Precision error; Stiffness
Index Keywords: Cutting; Cutting tools; Manipulators; Models; Precision engineering; Rigidity; Stiffness; Stiffness matrix; Charts; Controlling elements; Deformation Characteristics; Mathematic simulations; Precision errors; Rotary cutting tools; Theoretical foundations; Theoretical research; Robotics

Authors: Tian L., Gao Y.
Title: Crashworthiness Design of Automotive Body in White using Topology Optimization
Affiliations: Tongji University, China
Authors with affiliations: Tian, L., Tongji University, China; Gao, Y., Tongji University, China
Abstract: Based on equivalent static loads method (ESL), a nonlinear dynamic topology optimization is carried out to optimize an automotive body in white (BIW) subjected to representative legislative crash loads, including frontal impact, side barrier impact, roof crush and rear impact. To meet the crashworthiness performances, two evaluation indexes are defined to convert the practical engineering problems into mathematic optimization problems. The strain energy is treated as the stiffness evaluation index of the BIW and the relative displacement is employed as the compliance index of the components and parts. The optimization problem could be changed into maximizing structural stiffness of the design space while constraining the relative displacements of the passenger cabin lower than a certain value to guarantee the stiffness of passenger cabin, constraining the relative displacements of the front and rear cabin greater than a certain value to increase the energy absorption during the crash process. The results provide a conceptual design which emphasizes the most efficient load paths and could be served as an effective guidance to the next-step BIW detailed design. Copyright © 2016 SAE International.
Index Keywords: Accidents; Computer aided engineering; Conceptual design; Design; Optimization; Stiffness; Strain energy; Topology; Transportation; Crashworthiness designs; Equivalent static loads methods; Evaluation index; Mathematic optimization; Optimization problems; Practical engineering problems; Relative displacement; Structural stiffness; Crashworthiness

Authors: Yan X., Yue Y., Yue Q., Ma H., Hao C.
Title: Railway network blocking problem: Modeling formulation and branch- and cut algorithm
Affiliations: School of Traffic and Transportation, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3 Shang Yuan Cun, Hai Dian District, Beijing, China; Institute of Space System Engineering (ISSE), China Academy of Space Technology (CAST), No.31 South Street, Zhong Guan Cun, Hai Dian District, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Yan, X., School of Traffic and Transportation, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3 Shang Yuan Cun, Hai Dian District, Beijing, China; Yue, Y., School of Traffic and Transportation, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3 Shang Yuan Cun, Hai Dian District, Beijing, China; Yue, Q., Institute of Space System Engineering (ISSE), China Academy of Space Technology (CAST), No.31 South Street, Zhong Guan Cun, Hai Dian District, Beijing, China; Ma, H., School of Traffic and Transportation, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3 Shang Yuan Cun, Hai Dian District, Beijing, China; Hao, C., School of Traffic and Transportation, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3 Shang Yuan Cun, Hai Dian District, Beijing, China
Abstract: Railway Blocking Problem (RBP) is the core issue of the railway; in this paper we propose a novel network based mathematic model and branch-and-cut algorithms for RBP. Firstly we analyse the complexity of RBP for network compared with a single railway line. Then we propose model formulations and the details of the branch-and-cutalgorithm for RBP. The objective function is to minimize the costs of flow traveling and delay for the trains in marshalling stations, by deciding which block is built and specifying the assignment of commodities to these blocks, while observing limits on the break-up/make-up capacity at each terminal. The model is solved using branch-andcut algorithm. The algorithm has very fast computation speed due to the principle of cutting. The model and algorithm is tested on a real-world railway network located in North of China, the computation results show that the model and algorithm have the potential to apply and can yield the dramatic railroad's operating costs saving.
Author Keywords: Branch-and-cut algorithm; Optimization; Railway network; RBP
Index Keywords: Complex networks; Integer programming; Operating costs; Railroads; Transportation; Branch-and-cut algorithms; Fast computation speed; Marshalling station; Mathematic model; Model and algorithms; Model formulation; Objective functions; Railway network; Optimization

Authors: Wang Y., Hai W., Yuan X.
Title: Parametric Study on the Dynamic Interaction of a Centrifugal Shaker and Bucket
Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Earthquake Engineering and Engineering Vibration, Institute of Engineering Mechanics, China Earthquake Administration, 29 Xuefu Rd., Harbin, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, Y., Key Laboratory of Earthquake Engineering and Engineering Vibration, Institute of Engineering Mechanics, China Earthquake Administration, 29 Xuefu Rd., Harbin, China; Hai, W., Key Laboratory of Earthquake Engineering and Engineering Vibration, Institute of Engineering Mechanics, China Earthquake Administration, 29 Xuefu Rd., Harbin, China; Yuan, X., Key Laboratory of Earthquake Engineering and Engineering Vibration, Institute of Engineering Mechanics, China Earthquake Administration, 29 Xuefu Rd., Harbin, China
Abstract: Differing from common vibration testing facilities, bucket with limited mass and stiffness is used as reaction of centrifugal shaker to trigger reduced scale earthquakes. Dynamic interaction between centrifuge shaker and bucket is inevitably generated as a crucial issue for centrifugal shaker development, especially large scale. Based on the robust control strategy and general design of 1-D centrifugal shaker, an equivalent mathematic model for centrifugal shakers was developed and the corresponding transfer function was derived for analyzing the dynamic interaction of centrifugal shaker and bucket. A series of numerical analysis using the transfer function was performed to understand the influence of main parameters of bucket on the performance of centrifugal shaker through the dynamic interaction. A visible oscillation was observed around the first modal frequency of bucket. The results show that increases in the mass ratio or damping ratio of bucket are effective means to mitigate the oscillation, and the recommended parameter values are 4 and 0.1, respectively. The developed model and analyzed results provide references for optimal facility design and numerical simulation of dynamic centrifuge tests. © ASCE.
Author Keywords: Centrifugal shaker; Dynamic interaction; Geotechnical earthquake engineering; Parametric study; Transfer function
Index Keywords: Centrifuges; Earthquake engineering; Geophysics; Quality control; Robust control; Testing; Transfer functions; Centrifugal shakers; Common vibrations; Control strategies; Dynamic interaction; Facility designs; Geotechnical; Mathematic model; Parametric study; Centrifugation

Authors: Nugrahedi P.Y., Dekker M., Widianarko B., Verkerk R.
Title: Quality of cabbage during long term steaming; phytochemical, texture and colour evaluation
Affiliations: Food Quality and Design Group, Department of Agrotechnology and Food Science, Wageningen University, PO Box 17, Wageningen, Netherlands; Department of Food Technology, Soegijapranata Catholic University, Jl. Pawiyatan Luhur IV/1 Bendan Duwur, Semarang, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nugrahedi, P.Y., Food Quality and Design Group, Department of Agrotechnology and Food Science, Wageningen University, PO Box 17, Wageningen, Netherlands, Department of Food Technology, Soegijapranata Catholic University, Jl. Pawiyatan Luhur IV/1 Bendan Duwur, Semarang, Indonesia; Dekker, M., Food Quality and Design Group, Department of Agrotechnology and Food Science, Wageningen University, PO Box 17, Wageningen, Netherlands; Widianarko, B., Department of Food Technology, Soegijapranata Catholic University, Jl. Pawiyatan Luhur IV/1 Bendan Duwur, Semarang, Indonesia; Verkerk, R., Food Quality and Design Group, Department of Agrotechnology and Food Science, Wageningen University, PO Box 17, Wageningen, Netherlands
Abstract: Steaming has been reported to better retain the glucosinolate (GS) content in Brassica vegetables than boiling. However, there is little information on the GS content, colour, and texture attributes in Brassica vegetables in relation to the duration of steaming. This study investigated the effect of the duration of steaming, which was applied in certain commercial preparation processes, on the GS content, colour, and texture of white cabbage. Results showed that the total accessible content of GSs increases initially during steaming until 10 min followed by a consistent decline up to 180 min. This observed initial increase is mainly due to the content of aliphatic GSs rather than indole GSs, which tend to decrease from the start of steaming. A mathematic model for the observed behaviour of the GSs, taking into account several mechanisms, is proposed and fitted to the data. The intensity of the green colour of the cabbage slightly increased during the first 15 min of steaming followed by a decrease onwards. The hardness showed a continuous decline during the entire steaming duration. The study indicates that steaming up to 10 min could promote the health properties as well as the colour and texture attributes of steamed cabbage. © 2015 Elsevier Ltd.
Author Keywords: Cabbage; Glucosinolate; Modelling; Steaming
Index Keywords: Models; Thermal processing (foods); Vegetables; Brassica vegetables; Cabbage; Glucosinolates; Mathematic model; Phytochemical; Preparation process; Steaming; White cabbage; Color

Authors: Fang F., Shen L., Chen Y., Zhu Y.
Title: A method for measuring the weight of body segment based on human model and body pressure distribution
Affiliations: College of Furniture and Industrial Design, Nanjing Forestry University, Nanjing, China; College of Forest and Garden, Anhui Agricultural University, Hefei, China
Authors with affiliations: Fang, F., College of Furniture and Industrial Design, Nanjing Forestry University, Nanjing, China; Shen, L., College of Furniture and Industrial Design, Nanjing Forestry University, Nanjing, China; Chen, Y., College of Forest and Garden, Anhui Agricultural University, Hefei, China; Zhu, Y., College of Forest and Garden, Anhui Agricultural University, Hefei, China
Abstract: The weight of each human body segment is a very important parameter for zonal mattress design; it directly affects the design quality and lying comfort of zonal mattress. However, such researches or a method for measuring the weight of body segment to a living person has not been founded before. This paper explored a method for measuring the weight of body segment based on human model and body pressure distribution. Combined with three kinds of somatotypes, overweight, normal and underweight, using six different weight proportions of the human model, the pressure distribution experiment was carried out on a spring mattress and the regression model was constructed between the weight of each body segment and the force on human model. According to the mathematic model, the force of fifteen subjects (including seven females and eight males) on the same mattress and human anthropometrical measurement, the actual weight of each body segment could be calculated. The error analyzing shows that the mean relative error of the measurement results of three somatotypes was 2.4%. The error may be caused by the anthropometric measurement of subjects and the experimental instrument. The error range could be accepted and the method can be applied in the practice of mattress design. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2016.
Author Keywords: Anthropometry; Body pressure distribution; Human model; Mattress design; Weight of body segment
Index Keywords: Anthropometry; Errors; Pressure distribution; Regression analysis; Anthropometric measurement; Body pressure distribution; Body segment; Human body segments; Human Model; Mathematic model; Mean relative error; Regression model; Ergonomics

Authors: Du F.-S., Lü Z., Wang S.-Z., Huang H.-G., Sun J.-N., Xu Z.-Q.
Title: Analytical and experimental on the flow rule of molten pool for twin roll strip casting
Affiliations: National Engineering Research Center for Equipment and Technology of Cold Strip Rolling, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China
Authors with affiliations: Du, F.-S., National Engineering Research Center for Equipment and Technology of Cold Strip Rolling, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China; Lü, Z., National Engineering Research Center for Equipment and Technology of Cold Strip Rolling, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China; Wang, S.-Z., National Engineering Research Center for Equipment and Technology of Cold Strip Rolling, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China; Huang, H.-G., National Engineering Research Center for Equipment and Technology of Cold Strip Rolling, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China; Sun, J.-N., National Engineering Research Center for Equipment and Technology of Cold Strip Rolling, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China; Xu, Z.-Q., National Engineering Research Center for Equipment and Technology of Cold Strip Rolling, Yanshan University, Qinhuangdao, Hebei, China
Abstract: According to the similarity principle, a water model experiment platform for Twin-roll strip casting was set up by 1:1, then the influence of casting speed on the flow of molten pool has been studied, and a low-Reynolds-number turbulence mathematic model was developed to study the flow field and the temperature field of the molten pool. The results showed that the backflow occurred at the center region of molten pool by the effects of fluid viscosity and the rollers extrusion. The center region backflow would stir the molten pool and reduce the temperature to some extent which would make the temperature field and solute field uniform and steady. With the casting speed increased, the location of backflow would move down, the area of backflow zone would enlarge, and the effect of backflow would enhance. However, rapid casting speed would exacerbate the fluid level fluctuation or decrease the location of Kiss point excessively, which can affect the production quality. © 2016, Chinese Society for Metals. All right reserved.
Author Keywords: Center region backflow; Flow field; Fluid level fluctuation; Mathematic model; Water model

Authors: Zhu J.-H., Guo G., Wei L., Zhu M., Chen X.
Title: Dual function behavior of carbon fiber-reinforced polymer in simulated pore solution
Affiliations: Guangdong Province Key Laboratory of Durability for Marine Civil Engineering, School of Civil Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, Guangdong, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, J.-H., Guangdong Province Key Laboratory of Durability for Marine Civil Engineering, School of Civil Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, Guangdong, China; Guo, G., Guangdong Province Key Laboratory of Durability for Marine Civil Engineering, School of Civil Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, Guangdong, China; Wei, L., Guangdong Province Key Laboratory of Durability for Marine Civil Engineering, School of Civil Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, Guangdong, China; Zhu, M., Guangdong Province Key Laboratory of Durability for Marine Civil Engineering, School of Civil Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, Guangdong, China; Chen, X., Guangdong Province Key Laboratory of Durability for Marine Civil Engineering, School of Civil Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, Guangdong, China
Abstract: The mechanical and electrochemical performance of carbon fiber-reinforced polymer (CFRP) were investigated regarding a novel improvement in the load-carrying capacity and durability of reinforced concrete structures by adopting CFRP as both a structural strengthener and an anode of the impressed current cathodic protection (ICCP) system. The mechanical and anode performance of CFRP were investigated in an aqueous pore solution in which the electrolytes were available to the anode in a cured concrete structure. Accelerated polarization tests were designed with different test durations and various levels of applied currents in accordance with the international standard. The CFRP specimens were mechanically characterized after polarization. The measured feeding voltage and potential during the test period indicates CFRP have stable anode performance in a simulated pore solution. Two failure modes were observed through tensile testing. The tensile properties of the post-polarization CFRP specimens declined with an increased charge density. The CFRP demonstrated success as a structural strengthener and ICCP anode. We propose a mathematic model predicting the tensile strengths of CFRP with varied impressed charge densities. © 2016 by the authors.
Author Keywords: Anode; Corrosion; Electrical properties; Mechanical properties; Polymer-matrix composites (PMCs)
Index Keywords: Anodes; Carbon fiber reinforced plastics; Cathodic protection; Concrete buildings; Concrete construction; Concretes; Corrosion; Electric properties; Electrodes; Fiber reinforced plastics; Mechanical properties; Polarization; Polymer matrix composites; Reinforced plastics; Tensile strength; Tensile testing; Anode performance; Carbon fiber reinforced polymer; Electrochemical performance; Impressed current cathodic protection systems; International standards; Mathematic model; Polarization tests; Polymer Matrix Composites (PMCs); Reinforced concrete

Authors: Xu X.-G., Gu X.-H., Song X.-Y., Xu B., Yu H.-Y., Yang G.-J., Feng H.-K.
Title: Assessing the ratio of leaf carbon to nitrogen in winter wheat and spring barley based on hyperspectral data
Affiliations: Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, X.-G., Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China; Gu, X.-H., Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China; Song, X.-Y., Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China; Xu, B., Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China; Yu, H.-Y., Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China; Yang, G.-J., Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China; Feng, H.-K., Beijing Research Center for Information Technology in Agriculture, Beijing Academy of Agriculture and Forestry Sciences, P. O. Box 2449-26, Beijing, China
Abstract: The metabolic status of carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) as two essential elements of crop plants has significant influence on the ultimate formation of yield and quality in crop production. The ratio of carbon to nitrogen (C/N) from crop leaves, defined as ratio of LCC (leaf carbon concentration) to LNC (leaf nitrogen concentration), is an important index that can be used to diagnose the balance between carbon and nitrogen, nutrient status, growth vigor and disease resistance in crop plants. Thus, it is very significant for effectively evaluating crop growth in field to monitor changes of leaf C/N quickly and accurately. In this study, some typical indices aimed at N estimation and chlorophyll evaluation were tested to assess leaf C/N in winter wheat and spring barley. The multi-Temporal hyperspectral measurements from the flag-leaf, anthesis, filling, and milk-ripe stages were used to extract these selected spectral indices to estimate leaf C/N in wheat and barley. The analyses showed that some tested indices such as MTCI, MCARI/OSAVI2, and R-M had the better performance of assessing C/N for both of crops. Besides, a mathematic algorithm, Branch-And-Bound (BB) method was coupled with the spectral indices to assess leaf C/N in wheat and barley, and yielded the R2 values of 0.795 for winter wheat, R2 of 0.727 for spring barley, 0.788 for both crops combined. It demonstrates that using hyperspectral data has a good potential for remote assessment of leaf C/N in crops. © 2016 SPIE.
Author Keywords: Branch-And-bound method; Leaf C/N; Spectral index; Spring barley; Winter wheat
Index Keywords: Agriculture; Crops; Cultivation; Ecology; Ecosystems; Estimation; Hydrology; Nitrogen; Optical waveguides; Plants (botany); Remote sensing; Carbon and nitrogen; Carbon concentrations; Disease resistance; Hyperspectral measurements; Leaf C/N; Mathematic algorithms; Spectral indices; Winter wheat; Branch and bound method

Authors: Liu Y., Yang G.
Title: Autonomous optical and pulsar hybrid navigation method for deep space probe
Affiliations: Shanghai Institute of Spaceflight Control Technology, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Key Laboratory of Aerospace Intelligent Control Technology, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Y., Shanghai Institute of Spaceflight Control Technology, Shanghai, China; Yang, G., Shanghai Key Laboratory of Aerospace Intelligent Control Technology, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Deep space probes cruise deeply in the solar system, usually far away from the Earth. There is an unsolved key technology that how to obtain precise navigation information of the probe autonomously. Because of the effect of error accumulation, inertial navigation technology can't be adopted as the main navigation method for deep space probe, which maybe cruise in space several decades. Fully autonomous and higher accuracy are the characters of Pulsar Navigation (PN) technology, which make PN become one of the most potential navigation technology. PN has attracted many research works. But the X-ray energy emitted by pulsars for navigation is weakly, it is very difficult to develop the enough sensitive sensors for pulsar navigation. At present, a feasible schematic of sensor could receive the signals from 1~2 pulsars, and geometric position method could not be used. We can only use dynamic orbit determination method, while the observability of navigation system is worse. In order to improve the accuracy and the convergence rate of the dynamic orbit determination method which only adopt the observation of pulsars, we introduce the optical observation of vicinity celestial bodies, such as Mars, Jupiter and so on, when the probe cruises close to them. In this paper, we analyze the observability of vicinity celestial bodies firstly, and then establish the whole navigation algorithm in details., The obervability of the hybrid navigation system could be enhanced much more by introducing the optical observation of vicinity celestial bodies. The results of mathematic simulation shows that, the convergence time of the navigation algorithm could be reduced from several hours in one hour, and the accuracy of navigation could be improved from tens of kilometers to several kilometer, by adopting optical and pulsar hybrid autonomous navigation method.
Author Keywords: Autonomous optical navigation; Obervability; Pulsar navigation
Index Keywords: Air navigation; Earth (planet); Navigation systems; Observability; Orbits; Probes; Space probes; Autonomous navigation; Autonomous optical navigation; Mathematic simulations; Navigation algorithms; Navigation in formation; Navigation technology; Obervability; Pulsar navigations; Pulsars

Authors: Müller H., Görling C., Hintsch J., Splieth M., Starke S., Turowski K.
Title: Monitoring energy consumption on the service level a procedure model for multitenant ERP systems
Affiliations: Very Large Business Applications Lab., Faculty of Computer Science, Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg, Universitätspl. 2, Magdeburg, Germany
Authors with affiliations: Müller, H., Very Large Business Applications Lab., Faculty of Computer Science, Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg, Universitätspl. 2, Magdeburg, Germany; Görling, C., Very Large Business Applications Lab., Faculty of Computer Science, Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg, Universitätspl. 2, Magdeburg, Germany; Hintsch, J., Very Large Business Applications Lab., Faculty of Computer Science, Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg, Universitätspl. 2, Magdeburg, Germany; Splieth, M., Very Large Business Applications Lab., Faculty of Computer Science, Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg, Universitätspl. 2, Magdeburg, Germany; Starke, S., Very Large Business Applications Lab., Faculty of Computer Science, Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg, Universitätspl. 2, Magdeburg, Germany; Turowski, K., Very Large Business Applications Lab., Faculty of Computer Science, Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg, Universitätspl. 2, Magdeburg, Germany
Abstract: In this paper, we describe a procedure model for monitoring energy consumption of IT services. The model comprises the steps for identifying and extracting the required data, as well as a mathematic model to predict the energy consumption on both the infrastructure and the service level. Using the example of a distributed and shared ERP system, in which services are represented by ERP transactions, we evaluate the procedure model within a controlled experiment. The model was trained on monitoring data, gathered by performing a benchmark, which triggered more than 1,116,000 dialog steps, initiated by 6000 simulated SAP ERP users. During the benchmark, we monitored the dedicated resource usage for each transaction in terms of CPU time, database request time and database calls as well as the energy consumption of all servers involved in completing the transactions. Our developed procedure model enables IT service providers and business process outsourcers to assign their monitored hardware energy consumption to the actual consuming ERP transactions like creating sales orders, changing outbound deliveries or creating billing documents in watt per hour. The resulting dedicated energy costs can be transferred directly to overlying IT products or to individual organizations that share a multitenant ERP system. The research is mainly relevant for practitioners, especially for internal and external IT service providers. Our results serve as an early contribution to a paradigm shift in the granularity of energy monitoring, which needs to be carried forward to comply with an integrated and product-oriented information management and the ongoing extensive use of cloud- and IT service offerings in business departments. Copyright © 2016 by SCITEPRESS - Science and Technology Publications, Lda. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Accounting; Cloud; Energy consumption; Enterprise resource planning; Multitenancy; Pricing; Service
Index Keywords: Administrative data processing; Cloud computing; Clouds; Costs; Energy utilization; Information management; Nuclear fuel accounting; Business Process; Controlled experiment; Energy monitoring; IT service providers; Mathematic model; Multi tenancies; Procedure modeling; Service; Enterprise resource planning

Authors: Qin W., Wojtanowicz A.K., Luo P.
Title: Investigation of well production mechanism in heavy oil reservoirs underlain by strong bottom water
Affiliations: Post-Doctoral Science Research Station, Southwest Petroleum University, Chengdu, Sichuan, China; Chongqing University of Science and Technology, Chongqing, China; Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA, United States; Southwest Petroleum University, Chengdu, Sichuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Qin, W., Post-Doctoral Science Research Station, Southwest Petroleum University, Chengdu, Sichuan, China, Chongqing University of Science and Technology, Chongqing, China; Wojtanowicz, A.K., Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA, United States; Luo, P., Southwest Petroleum University, Chengdu, Sichuan, China
Abstract: Low recovery factor is identified as the main problem encountered in the heavy oil production from a strong bottom-water-drive reservoir. Unlike for conventional oils, where the expected recovery from such reservoirs could be very high - in excess of 50 percent, the expected recovery factor in heavy oil water-driven reservoirs is less than 20 percent. In this study, a qualitative analysis of the well productivity mechanisms specific for heavy oil reservoirs with bottom water is provided. The objective is to understand what make the production of heavy oil different to that of lighter oils, identify the mechanism that mostly hamper the well's productivity and recovery efficiency. Many believe the by-passed oil due to water coning is the major cause of low ultimate oil recovery in heavy oils underlain by strong bottom water. However, in this paper, we identify another important parameter affecting recovery efficiency in such reservoirs, which hasn't been recognized by others and its effect on recovery process is significant. The mathematic modeling and numerical study lead to a new finding: due to the aquifer's influence on pressure response in reservoir, a no-flow boundary at xi is established, where xi is often much smaller than that of the actual reservoir size xe. The oil out to the distance xi is immobile and become bypassed oil, which accounts for large amount of the OOIP. Even the water coning can be effective controlled; the ultimate oil recovery factor will not be improved significantly if the small mobilized oil zone can't be enlarged. An analytical solution is derived in this paper to calculate the actual drainage radius. The validity of this analytical solution is confirmed by numerical simulation runs. Copyright © 2016 by ASME.
Index Keywords: Aquifers; Arctic engineering; Crude oil; Efficiency; Offshore oil wells; Oil well flooding; Petroleum reservoir engineering; Petroleum reservoir evaluation; Petroleum reservoirs; Productivity; Recovery; Heavy oil reservoirs; Mathematic model; No-flow boundaries; Pressure response; Qualitative analysis; Recovery efficiency; Recovery factors; Well productivity; Heavy oil production

Authors: Sun Y., Li W., Qiang H., Chang D.
Title: An experimental study on the vibration of the low-speed maglev train moving on the guideway with sag vertical curves
Affiliations: School of Mechanical Engineering, Tongji University, China; College of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Maritime University, China
Authors with affiliations: Sun, Y., School of Mechanical Engineering, Tongji University, China, College of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Maritime University, China; Li, W., School of Mechanical Engineering, Tongji University, China; Qiang, H., College of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Maritime University, China; Chang, D., College of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Maritime University, China
Abstract: The low-speed maglev transportation technology is becoming a new type of urban rail transit. The vibration of the train is the crucial point for comfort and performance of the new type transit. The trial operation of the low-speed maglev train shows that a strong vibration of the vehicle may occur when the vehicle moves on the rail with sag vertical curves. In order to analyze and prevent this problem, a multi-sensor low-speed maglev vehicle experimental platform is established. The vibration signals are collected, processed and analyzed by the experiment. We present that the spiral transition curve should be put into the rail to reduce the vibration. The experimental results are included to provide valuable reference for the design and construction of the low-speed maglev transportation line. © 2016 SERSC.
Author Keywords: Maglev vehicle; Mathematic model; Multi-sensor platform; Sag vertical curves; Vibration

Abstract: Considered the model of formation of the fibrous flow based on nonhomogeneous Markov chain. Found out the conditional maximum of the quadratic irregularity of the flow at a given average thickness of flow. Investigated the influence of the quadratic irregularity on the probability the quadratic irregularity of fibrous flow at different average values of the probability.

Authors: Wang K., Li X., Tian X.
Title: On ambiguity issues of converting LaTeX mathematical formula to content MathML
Affiliations: Hebei Key Laboratory of Machine Learning and Computational Intelligence, College of Computer Science and Technology, Hebei University, Shijiazhuang, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, K., Hebei Key Laboratory of Machine Learning and Computational Intelligence, College of Computer Science and Technology, Hebei University, Shijiazhuang, China; Li, X., Hebei Key Laboratory of Machine Learning and Computational Intelligence, College of Computer Science and Technology, Hebei University, Shijiazhuang, China; Tian, X., Hebei Key Laboratory of Machine Learning and Computational Intelligence, College of Computer Science and Technology, Hebei University, Shijiazhuang, China
Abstract: Facing the demand of providing retrieval result with rich semantic information for users in math searching, mathematical formulas of LaTeX are usually converted to Content MathML. For the problem of ambiguity formulas in the process of conversion, a method of semantic disambiguation for mathematics formulas which is based on the operator context was proposed. At first, ambiguity operator was found according to the ambiguity operator mapping table. Then, the ambiguity operator context is got through the array traversal. At last, the specific meaning was conjectured according to the ambiguity operator context. The experimental results show that compared with the type-system the method can make up for its disadvantages in simple formulas aspect and gets a higher average accuracy. In practical application, this method can effectively solve the problem of ambiguity formulas in the process of conversion. © Institute for Computer Sciences, Social Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering 2016.
Author Keywords: Ambiguity formula; Content MathML; LaTeX; Mathematic formula conversion; Semantic of formula
Index Keywords: Distributed computer systems; Latexes; Semantics; Ambiguity formula; Content mathml; Mathematical formulas; Semantic disambiguation; Semantic information; Type systems; Mathematical operators

Authors: Lmati I., Benlahmar H., Achtaich N.

Abstract: This paper presents a semantic annotation of mathematics exercises based on the canonical form of variables or formulas used in the text of exercise. A MathML representation of mathematical formulas has been exploited for the extraction of canonical forms. An extension of the educational ontology Math-Bridge is used for semantic annotation. The ontology consists of all the themes and sub-themes of algebra hierarchically structured by generalization relationships. Each themes of ontology contain useful new attributes for annotation. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2016.

Authors: Huang Q., Li J., Li H., Han H., Ma L.
Title: Stability analysis of mathematical model for new hydraulic bilateral rolling shear
Affiliations: Heavy Machinery Eng., Research Center of Education Ministry, Taiyuan Univ. of Sci. and Technol., Taiyuan, China; Hebei Wenfeng Iron and Steel Co. Ltd., Hebei, Wuan, China
